OpenAI Lands Pentagon Deal, NVIDIA Declares Agentic AI "Inflection Point," Meta Rolls Out Manus AI

Today's top stories in AI + Product Marketing

1

OpenAI Secures Pentagon Deal Hours After Anthropic Blacklisted

In a dramatic 24-hour sequence, OpenAI announced a deal with the Department of Defense to deploy its AI models on classified networks ‚Äî just hours after the Trump administration designated rival Anthropic a "supply chain risk to national security." Anthropic refused to remove its safety guardrails; OpenAI says it negotiated similar protections but made the deal work. The implications for enterprise AI procurement are massive.

Read on Fortune ‚Üí
2

NVIDIA: Enterprise Agentic AI Has Reached an "Inflection Point"

Jensen Huang declared enterprise agentic AI adoption has hit an inflection point during NVIDIA's earnings call. The numbers back it up: fiscal 2026 revenue reached $216 billion ‚Äî up 65% year-over-year. The message for PMMs: agentic AI isn't experimental anymore. Enterprise budgets are flowing, and the use cases are real.

Read on Time News ‚Üí
3

Microsoft Unveils Azure Foundry for Agentic AI at GTC 2026

At NVIDIA GTC 2026, Microsoft showcased Azure Foundry ‚Äî its comprehensive platform for building, deploying, and operating agentic AI systems with "enterprise reliability." The focus: helping companies move from concept to production with confidence. This is the infrastructure layer that makes marketing automation agents actually deployable at scale.

Read on Microsoft Tech Community ‚Üí
4

Meta Actively Rolling Out Manus AI to Advertisers

Meta is now actively surfacing Manus AI to advertisers with in-stream prompts inside Ads Manager. The AI agent handles research, reporting, and campaign optimization ‚Äî and it's no longer opt-in. For PMMs running paid social, this is the moment AI becomes native to the workflow rather than a third-party add-on.

Read on Summit ‚Üí
5

Salesforce + Qualified: Agentic Marketing Enters the Revenue Architecture

Salesforce's acquisition of Qualified signals where marketing automation is headed. The platform's AI agents handle visitor intent detection, conversational AI, lead scoring, routing, and real-time scheduling ‚Äî all inside Salesforce. This isn't bolted-on AI; it's agentic marketing baked into the core CRM.

Read on Atrium ‚Üí

üí° My Take

Big week for enterprise AI. The OpenAI/Anthropic/Pentagon drama is the headline, but the NVIDIA earnings tell the real story: agentic AI adoption has crossed from pilot to production. The infrastructure is ready (Azure Foundry), the platforms are baking it in (Meta, Salesforce), and the budgets are allocated ($216B doesn't lie). If you're in PMM and still treating AI as experimental, you're already behind.
